content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Max Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Hello Max, it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure you'll find this apartment to be a great investment for your living needs. How much were you considering for the monthly rent?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm a student and I'm looking for a place that's not only comfortable but also fits within my budget. I'd like to pay a fair price for this apartment. Could you tell me what you're asking for the monthly rent?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, as a landlord, I'm always looking to strike a balance between fair pricing and ensuring the apartment is well-maintained. For a newly built, centrally located property like this, I would typically expect a rent of around 1,200 Euros per month. However, I'm willing to negotiate a bit if you're a serious tenant. What did you have in mind?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, 1,200 Euros per month is quite high for a student like me. I'm looking for something more affordable. Would you be willing to lower the price?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I understand that as a student, every euro counts. While 1,200 Euros is indeed a fair market price for this apartment, I am willing to consider a reduction for the right tenant. How much were you thinking of paying?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'd be more comfortable with a price around 800 Euros per month. This would be more in line with my budget as a student. Is that something we can discuss?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, your offer of 800 Euros is significantly lower than what I would consider a fair price for this apartment. However, I'm willing to negotiate. How about we meet in the middle at 1,000 Euros per month? This would still be a great deal for you, considering the location and the quality of the apartment. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, 1,000 Euros per month is more reasonable. I appreciate your willingness to meet in the middle. This is closer to my budget, and I would be willing to agree to this price. However, I would like to discuss any additional costs or fees that might be associated with the lease.
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, I'm glad we've come to an agreement on the monthly rent. Regarding additional costs, there is a one-time administrative fee of 200 Euros, which covers the cost of setting up the lease and any associated paperwork. There are no other hidden fees. Does this sound acceptable to you?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, a one-time administrative fee of 200 Euros is reasonable. I understand that there are costs associated with setting up the lease. I would be willing to pay this fee if it's a one-time charge. Is there anything else I should know about additional costs or conditions of the lease?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, there are no other additional costs. The 200 Euros administrative fee is a one-time charge, and it covers all the necessary paperwork and set-up for the lease. Once that's taken care of, your monthly rent will be 1,000 Euros. Is there anything else you would like to discuss before we proceed?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm satisfied with the terms we've discussed. The monthly rent of 1,000 Euros and the one-time administrative fee of 200 Euros are acceptable to me. I'm ready to proceed with the lease. Is there anything else I need to do to secure the apartment?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, to secure the apartment, we will need to go through a formal rental agreement. I will provide you with the necessary paperwork, and once you've reviewed and signed it, we'll need a small security deposit to hold the apartment. The deposit is typically one month's rent, which in this case would be 1,000 Euros. Once the deposit is received, the apartment will be yours to move into. Is this acceptable to you?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, a security deposit of 1,000 Euros is standard practice and I understand its purpose. I'm comfortable with this arrangement as long as it is refundable upon the termination of the lease, provided there are no damages or outstanding fees. Can you confirm that the deposit will be refunded under these conditions?
name: Max Müller from Germany

content: Max, you are correct. The security deposit is refundable at the end of the lease term, provided there are no damages to the property beyond normal wear and tear, and there are no outstanding fees or utilities unpaid. We will go over the condition of the apartment together before you move in and again when you move out to ensure a smooth transition. Is there anything else you would like to discuss or clarify before we proceed with the rental agreement?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Mister Schmidt, I'm satisfied with the terms of the lease. The monthly rent of 1,000 Euros, the one-time administrative fee of 200 Euros, and the refundable security deposit of 1,000 Euros are all acceptable to me. I'm ready to proceed with the rental agreement. Please provide me with the necessary paperwork, and I will sign it promptly. TERMINATE
name: Max Müller from Germany
